saberes: - Self-confidence in the use of the foreign language.
- Introduction to elementary strategies for the comprehension and production of brief, simple and contextualized oral, written and multimodal texts.

- Elementary communicative functions appropriate to the setting and context: greeting, saying goodbye, introducing and introducing oneself; identifying the characteristics of people, objects and places; answering specific questions about everyday issues; expressing time, quantity and space, possession , request and offer of help, expression of tastes, expression of emotions, expressions of place and address, request for personal information and permission, instructions from the class context, expression of ability.
- Elementary contextual models in the comprehension and production of short and simple oral, written and multimodal texts, such as congratulations, notes, lists or notices.
- Elementary linguistic units and meanings associated with said structures such as expression of the entity and its properties, quantity and number, affirmation, exclamation, negation, interrogation.

- Elementary vocabulary of interest to students related to basic interpersonal relationships, housing, nearby places and environments: school and school materials, personal identification, the family, colors, numbers, food and drinks, toys, parts of the body and clothing, animals, days of the week, natural environment and weather, adjectives to describe, verbs (to be, have got, like, can in the present), some words related to technology Lexicon related to celebrations and traditions: Halloween, Christmas, Easter .
- Initiation to elementary sound and accentual patterns.Initiation to elementary orthographic conventions.
- Elementary conversational conventions and strategies, in synchronous or asynchronous format, to start, maintain and end communication, take and give the floor, ask and answer, etc.
- Elementary analog and digital tools for oral, written and multimodal comprehension and production.
- Elementary strategies and techniques for detecting communicative deficiencies and limitations derived from the level of competence in the foreign language and in the family languages.

- Introduction to elementary strategies to identify and use linguistic units (lexicon, morphosyntax, sound patterns, etc.) from the comparison of the languages and varieties that make up the personal linguistic repertoire.
- The foreign language as a means of communication and relationship with people from other countries.
- Elementary and most significant sociocultural and sociolinguistic aspects related to customs and daily life in countries where the foreign language is spoken.
- Initiation to the basic strategies of common use to understand and appreciate the linguistic, cultural and artistic diversity, attending to ecosocial and democratic values.
criteriosEvaluacion: 1.1. Recognize and interpret common words and expressions in brief and simple oral, written and multimodal texts on frequent and daily topics of personal relevance and close to their experience, expressed in an understandable, clear, simple and direct way, and in standard language.

1.2. Select and apply elementary strategies in everyday communicative situations relevant to the students in a guided way in order to capture the overall idea and identify specific elements with the help of linguistic and non-linguistic elements of the context and cotext.

2.1. Orally express short and simple sentences with basic information about everyday matters and relevant to the students, using verbal and non-verbal resources in a guided way, resorting to models and structures previously presented and paying attention to rhythm, stress and intonation .

2.2. Produce words, well-known expressions and phrases based on models and with a specific purpose, through analog and digital tools, using elementary structures and vocabulary on everyday matters and of personal relevance to the students.

2.3. Select and apply basic strategies in a guided way to produce brief and simple messages appropriate to the communicative intentions using, with help, resources and physical or digital supports depending on the needs of each moment.

3.1. Participate, in a guided way, in elementary interactive situations on daily topics, previously prepared, through various supports, relying on resources such as repetition, slow rhythm or non-verbal language, and showing empathy.

3.2. Select and use, in a guided way and in close environments, elementary strategies for greeting, saying goodbye and introducing oneself; expressing simple and brief messages; and formulating and answering basic questions for communication.

4.1. Interpret and explain basic information of concepts, communications and short and simple texts, in a guided way, in situations in which to attend to diversity, showing empathy and interest for the interlocutors and for the problems of understanding in their environment immediately, relying on various resources and supports.
5.1. Compare and contrast obvious similarities and differences between different languages reflecting, in a guided way, on elementary aspects of their functioning.

5.2. Identify and apply, in a guided way, knowledge and strategies to improve their ability to communicate and learn the foreign language, with the support of other participants and analog and digital supports.
5.3. Identify and explain, in a guided way, progress and elementary difficulties in learning the foreign language.
6.1. Show interest in intercultural communication, identifying and, in a guided way, the most common discriminations, prejudices and stereotypes, in everyday and habitual situations.
6.2. Recognize and appreciate the linguistic and cultural diversity related to the foreign language, showing interest in knowing its elementary cultural and linguistic elements.
